block.p: Europe's largest drug company, AstraZeneca P.L.C., said its first-quarter earnings rose 14 percent. Pretax profit jumped to $1.1 billion from $971 million a year earlier. Dr. Thomas F. W. McKillop, the company's chief executive, said, ''The year has started encouragingly.'' But the company's shares fell over concern that the company does not have another blockbuster drug to replace its ulcer drug Losec, which loses its patent next year.

Europe's largest drug company, AstraZeneca P.L.C., said its first-quarter earnings rose 14 percent. Pretax profit jumped to $1.1 billion from $971 million a year earlier. Dr. Thomas F. W. McKillop, the company's chief executive, said, ''The year has started encouragingly.'' But the company's shares fell over concern that the company does not have another blockbuster drug to replace its ulcer drug Losec, which loses its patent next year.
